Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Edison Bond, Citadel of Praise and Worship, 1700 Fulton Street, Brooklyn, NY 11213.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Vann.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Edison Bond, Citadel of Praise and Worship, 1700 Fulton Street, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11213.

Council Member Vann moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of December 18, 2012 and January 9, 2013 be adopted as printed by Council Member Lappin.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Lappin moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of December 18, 2012 and the Charter Meeting of January 9, 2013 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Communication from the Mayor – Transmitting proposed amendment to a maritime lease between the New York City Department of Small Business Services  and Sea Travelers Realty Inc. d/b/a Sea Travelers Marina for certain city owned upland area and lands under water located in the Mill Basin area of Brooklyn, pursuant to Section 1301(2)(f) of the City Charter. This amendment would supersede the lease amendment adopted by the Council on September 12, 2012.
Items.AgendaNote: Landmarks, Public Siting and Maritime Uses

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 230 West 54th Street, Community Board No. 5, Application no.  20135250 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 230 W. 54th St, Manhattan (20135250 TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Reyna:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 50 Wyckoff Avenue, Community Board No. 4, Application no.  20135222 TCK shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 50 Wyckoff Ave, Brooklyn (20135222 TCK)

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring city plantings to be stormwater tolerant so as to facilitate stormwater retention and filtration.

Items.MatterName: Increasing native biodiversity in public landscapes.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of a renewable energy systems web portal.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Creation of a renewable energy systems web portal.

Items.Title: Resolution commending Governor Cuomo and the New York State Legislature for enacting the New York Secure Ammunition and Firearms Enforcement (SAFE) Act of 2013 and urging other states to pass similar gun control legislation.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Finance
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following Council Member formally voted against this item:  Council Members Halloran.



The following 3 Council Members formally abstained to vote on this item:  Council Members Ignizio, Ulrich and Oddo.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Commending Governor Cuomo and the NYS Legislature for enacting the NY Secure Ammunition and Firearms Enforcement (SAFE) Act of 2013.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress and the President of the United States to increase funding for research on stroke prevention and treatment.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Health
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.


Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Increase funding for research on stroke prevention and treatment.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Land Use

Resolution approving modification to a previously approved Urban Development Action Area Project located at 1413 Pitkin Avenue (Block 1475/Lot 78); Borough of Brooklyn, approving the disposition of real property located at 1416 Eastern Parkway Extension (Block 1475/Lot 39); Borough of Brooklyn; approving a tax exemption for the Project Area; and waiving the urban development action area designation requirement and the Uniform Land Use Review Procedure, pursuant to Article 16 of the New York General Municipal Law (L.U. No. 719; 20135098 HAK).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 719 - UDAAP, 1416 Eastern Parkway Extension to the disposition area, creating a new project area, 1416 Eastern Parkway Extrension & 1413 Pitkin Ave, Brooklyn (20135098 HAK)

Items.MatterName: LU 749 - Zoning, West 58th St, Eleventh Ave, West 57th St and Twelfth Ave, Manhattan (120396 ZMM)

Items.Title: Resolution approving the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 120397 ZSM (L.U. No. 750), for the grant of a special permit pursuant to the following sections of the Zoning Resolution Section 74-743(a)(1) - to allow the distribution of total allowable floor area under the applicable district regulations without regard for zoning district lines; and Section 74-743(a)(2) - to allow the location of buildings without regard for the front wall height and initial setback requirements of Section 33-432, the tower requirements of Section 33-451, and the distance between building requirements of Section 23-711; in connection with a proposed mixed-use development, on property bounded by West 58th Street, Eleventh Avenue, West 57th Street, and Twelfth Avenue (Block 1105, Lots 1, 5, 14, 19, 29, 36, and 43), within a Large-Scale General Development, in C4-7 and C6-2 Districts, within the Special Clinton District (Other Areas (Northern Subarea C1)), Borough of Manhattan.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 750 - Zoning, West 58th St, Eleventh Ave, West 57th St and Twelfth Ave, Manhattan (120397 ZSM)

Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of sanitation to collect and report data related to the unlawful posting of printed material.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to advance posting of temporary tow-away zones.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Advance posting of temporary tow-away zones.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to renaming one thoroughfare in the Borough of Queens, Ryan Court, and to amend the official map of the city of New York accordingly.

Items.MatterName: Name Change, Ryan Court, Queens

Items.Title: Resolution in support of granting the officers of the Co-op City Department of Public Safety peace officer status.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Support of granting the officers of the Co-op City Department of Public Safety peace officer status.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing October 11 as the “Day of the Girl Child” in New York City.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women's Issues
Items.MatterName: Recognizing October 11 as the “Day of the Girl Child” in NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Environmental Protection Agency and President Obama to fully enforce the Clean Air Act by regulating greenhouse gases in order to avert the potentially catastrophic effects of climate change.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Enforce the Clean Air Act by regulating greenhouse gases in order to avert the potentially catastrophic effects of climate change.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning amendments to the District Plan of the Hub Third Avenue Business Improvement District that add services and modify existing services in the district, add a capital improvement program in the district, change the method of assessment upon which the district charge is based, and increase the maximum total amount to be expended for improvements in the district, and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing of the local law authorizing such changes as set forth in the amended District Plan of the Hub Third Avenue Business Improvement District.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Hub Third Avenue BID

Items.Title: Resolution concerning an amendment to the District Plan of the Myrtle Avenue Business Improvement District that authorizes additional services and modifies existing services for the district, and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing of the local law authorizing additional services and modifying existing services for the district.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Myrtle Avenue BID

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Federal Government to support H.R. 3086, the Fair Wages for Workers with Disabilities Act of 2011, which phases out the issuance of special wage certificates under the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Fair Wages for Workers with Disabilities Act of 2011 (H.R. 3086)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to introduce and pass legislation that would amend the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act to allow aid to be given to houses of worship affected by Hurricane Sandy.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Congress to introduce and pass legislation that would amend the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the New York State General Business Law to classify price gouging as a class A misdemeanor.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: NYS General Business Law to classify price gouging as a class A misdemeanor.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk

Items.Title: Application no. 20135162 TCM, pursuant to §20-226 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York, concerning the petition of Naco NYC LLC, d/b/a El Toro Blanco, for a revocable consent to establish, maintain and operate an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 10 Downing Street, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board 2, Council District 3.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226(e) of the New York City Administrative Code.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 10 Downing St, Manhattan (20135162 TCM)

Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

At this point, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.
The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera)  put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:



LU No. 752 & Res No. 1660, 48-1-0 (Negative: Ignizio)

See files for individual votes.
There is presently one vacancy in the Council pending the swearing-in of the certified winner of the scheduled February 19, 2013 Special Election to be held in the 31st Council District, Queens.

Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Landmarks, Public Siting and Maritime Uses
